ext2

Class Ext2File

  • java.lang.Object
    • ext2.DataBlock
      • ext2.Ext2File

  • public class Ext2File
extends DataBlock
    Title: Ext2File This class represents a file within a given volume. For the ext2 filesystem, this class represents a file within the filesystem. This class is an extension of the DataBlock which provides further functionality for reading blocks and obtaining bytes.
    See Also:
    DataBlock

    • Constructor Summary

      Ext2File(Volume vol, java.lang.String filePathString)
      Constructor used to represent a file in the given volume and initialise relevant instance variables.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Ext2File

        public Ext2File(Volume vol,
                java.lang.String filePathString)
        Constructor used to represent a file in the given volume and initialise relevant instance variables. The file can then be read and output to the user and can also view important info.
        Parameters:
        vol - The volume represented by the file opened.
        filePathString - The name of the file to open in the volume.

    • Method Detail

      • read

        public byte[] read(long startByte,
                   long length)
            throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Method to read the file the user specified in the file string. The method will read bytes from startByte up to the length they provide. An array of bytes will be returned containing all bytes in the file. If the file is sparse, a sequence of 0s will be returned alongisde the file data.
        Parameters:
        startByte - The byte to start reading from in the file.
        length - The length of the file the user wishes to read in bytes.
        Returns:
        An array of bytes relevant to the file opened.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - Throw an index out of bounds exception if no data can be located.

      • read

        public byte[] read(long length)
            throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Method to read the file the user specified in the file string. This method is the same as the other read method in the API, however only requires a length to read. This method therefore calls the corresponding read method at the current position in the file.
        Parameters:
        length - The length of the file the user wishes to read in bytes.
        Returns:
        An array of bytes relevant to the file opened.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - Throw an index out of bounds exception if no data can be located.

      • seek

        public void seek(long position)
        Method to allow the user to change the position in the file (for reading).
        Parameters:
        position - The position in the file the user wishes to move to.

      • getPosition

        public long getPosition()
        Method to return the current position in the file (i.e. byte offset from the start of the file). The position will be 0 when the file is first opened and will advance by the number of bytes read with every call to one of the read methods.
        Returns:
        The current position in the file.

      • getSize

        public long getSize()
        Returns the size of this ext2 file in bytes.
        Returns:
        The file size.

      • printDirectoryInfo

        public void printDirectoryInfo()
        Method which prints the directory information for this file.

      • printFileContents

        public void printFileContents(byte[] bytes)
        Simple method to print the contents of a file specified in the byte array in a regular format.
        Parameters:
        bytes - The array of bytes containing file info to be printed.

      • getFileInfoList

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getFileInfoList()
        Returns the list of strings for all files names in a given directory.
        Returns:
        The list of file name strings.

      • isDirectory

        public boolean isDirectory()
        Returns true if this file is a directory, false otherwise.
        Returns:
        True for directory, false for regular file.
